Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis.stats

Class ParentChildPValuesCalculation.Counts

java.lang.Object
org.monarchinitiative.phenol.analysis.stats.ParentChildPValuesCalculation.Counts
Enclosing class:
ParentChildPValuesCalculation
protected static class ParentChildPValuesCalculation.Counts extends Object
Counts is a convenience class used to help calculate the hypergeometric p values for the Parent Child meethods. We need to have n_t: the number of terms in the study set annotated to GO Term t, n_pa_t, the number of terms in the study set annotated to the parents of t.

  • Field Details

    • n_pa_t

      public final int n_pa_t
      The original study set consists, say, of all differentially expressed genes. For the PC approaches, the study set is redefined as the intersection of the original study-set and m_pa_t. This variable stores the size of that set. For the PC approaches, this is the size of the intersection of the study set and m_pa(t). See Figure 1B of Improved detection of overrepresentation of Gene-Ontology annotations with parent child analysis (PMID:17848398) n_pa_t refers to the terms in the study set that are annotated to the parent(s) of t

    • m_pa_t

      public final int m_pa_t
      Size of the set of terms annotated to the parent(s) of Term t. The set is calculated differently for the PC Union/Intersection methods

    • m_t

      public final int m_t
      Number of terms in population annotated to t

    • n_t

      public final int n_t
      Number of terms in study set annotated to t

  • Constructor Details

    • Counts

      public Counts(int n_pa_t, int m_pa_t, int n_t, int m_t)

  • Method Details

    • get_proportion

      public double get_proportion()
      For the PC approaches, this is the size of the intersection of the study set and m_pa(t). See Figure 1B of Improved detection of overrepresentation of Gene-Ontology annotations with parent * child analysis (PMID:17848398)
